tests

Class RastriginFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.RastriginFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class RastriginFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    This class implements the Rastrigin Function in n-dimensions. The Rastrigin function is defined as follows: $$ f(x)= An + \sum_{i=1}^n [x_i^2 - Acos(w x_i)] $$ By default, A=10, w=2Ï€.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(java.lang.Object arg, java.util.HashMap p)
      evaluate the Rastrigin function at x=arg, for the values A and w given in the p HashMap.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.RastriginFunction <A> <w> <x_1> ...

        public RastriginFunction()
        public no-arg constructor

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object arg,
                   java.util.HashMap p)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        evaluate the Rastrigin function at x=arg, for the values A and w given in the p HashMap.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        arg - Object must be double[] or popt4jlib.VectorIntf.
        p - HashMap must contain the following two parameters:
        • <"A", Double val> the value for the "A" parameter
        • <"w", Double val> the value for the "w" parameter
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments above do not adhere to their specification (or if any is null)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.RastriginFunction <A> <w> <x_1> ... <x_n> where the arguments x_1 ... x_n are the values of the components of the vector point at which the function is to be evaluated.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
